results.title: Ghost of the Spanish Warrior
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Moors and Christians festival of Alicoy in Alicante, Spain celebrates the defeat of the Moors by Christians after 500 years of occupation which left an indelible mark on Spanish culture and architecture. Led by a boy representing St. George, the town’s patron saint, groups of ‘crusaders’ stage a symbolic battle against the ‘moors’.

results.title: Ghost in the shell (D)
results.creator_credit: Kodonsha, Manga Entertainment, Bondai Visual, Yoshimasa Mizou, Ken Matsumoto, Ken Iyadomi, Mitsuhisa ishikawa and Mamoru Oshii
results.brief_description: In the tradition of ‘Akira’, ‘Ghost in the shell’ features excellent animation which will impress. Set in the cyberspace worlds of artificial intelligence and sophisticated computer technology, this violent and complex adventure revolves around a ghostly agent whose job is to determine who is real and who is a cybernetic creation. When a master hacker learns to break into the minds of his victims, the ‘Ghost in the shell’ must foil his evil attempts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kodonsha, Manga Entertainment, Bondai Visual, Yoshimasa Mizou, Ken Matsumoto, Ken Iyadomi, Mitsuhisa ishikawa and Mamoru Oshii

results.title: Ghost hunters
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Walford Hewitson, Frank Spiller and Erik Nielsen
results.brief_description: A flight in the Royal Canadian Air Force’s Argus airplane, to Gibraltar and back, provides a convincing demonstration of Canada’s wide-ranging defense against underwater attack. Specially designed and electronically equipped for detecting submarines, this tireless airborne hunter can stay aloft a full day, probing for its hidden foe.

results.title: Ghost dog: way of the samurai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: JVC, Studio Canal+, Bac Films (France), Richard Guay and Jim Jarmusch
results.brief_description: In a terrific central performance, Forest Whitaker plays Ghost Dog, an ex-gangster and thug, who after his conversion to the spiritual asceticism of the ancient Samurai code, has turned away from vice and sin to raise pigeons and contemplating the meaning of life. His one connection to the old criminal world is to be a hitman for a mafia don to whom he owes his life. Jim Jarmusch’s film is part film-noir, part gangster movie and part thriller, yet transcends any simplistic genre categorisation. Instead, what this deeply humane film investigates is the loss and fear prevalent in contemporary culture when traditional moral codes have broken down (ironically, represented by the mafia), and as yet people are unsure of what will take the place of old certainties. For Ghost Dog the answer lies both in a return to the past, as well as embracing the new relationship of a multicultural diverse world. This is an exciting thriller with an outstanding hip-hop soundtrack, as well as being a deeply meditative film about race, class and difference.

results.title: Ghost
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Lisa Weinstein, Howard W. Koch and Jerry Zucker
results.brief_description: Beginning as a romantic comedy, Sam (Patrick Swayze) and Molly (Demi Moore) are in the middle of a serious relationship. They are building a house and preparing to move in together. Walking home one night they are mugged and as a result Sam is murdered. The film then takes a fantastic turn as Sam wanders the spirit world trying to understand why he was killed. He discovers his murder was plotted by one of his associates and through psychic Oda Mae (Whoopie Goldberg) tries to contact Molly and protect her from meeting the same fate as him.

results.title: Ghidrah: the three headed monster [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Toho Kabushiki Kaisha, Tomoyuki Tanaka and Ishiro Honda
results.brief_description: One of the most memorable Godzilla movies, “Ghidrah, the Three Headed Monster” was rushed into production and was released in Japanese theatres the same year as Godzilla vs. Mothra. It featured the debut of Godzilla’s soon-to-be most popular foe: King Ghidorah (changed to Ghidrah for the US release). It was also the monster Rodan’s debut movie in the Godzilla series. When Ghidrah, a three headed extra-terrestrial, threatens the well-being of the planet, desperate humans invite friendly monsters Mothra, Rodan and Godzilla to help them fight the space creature. Ghidrah is an important Godzilla film because it created a major turning point in the Showa Godzilla series. From this movie on, Godzilla would undergo a slow transition from an evil monster into a savior of the world. This transition would also mark the decreasing popularity of Godzilla in both the U.S. and Japan. Cast includes Yosuke Natsuki, Yuriko Hoshi and Hiroshi Koizumi. Special effects by Eiji Tsuburaya. Dubbed into English.

results.title: Ghanaian Village
results.brief_description: Looks at a day in the life of a family living in a Ghanaian fishing village. Division of labour, preparation of food and daily activity are some of the highlights.

results.title: Ghana: ways forward
results.brief_description: Considers that progress in the form pf automation may have come too early for a country like Ghana. Now many of the population are idle. Looks at government instigated self-help programmes, which utilise the country’s biggest resource - people and aid in productivity.

results.title: Ghana: using what's around you
results.brief_description: This film shows how people living in a remote areas make do with a narrow range of foods and raw materials obtained from their immediate surroundings and how the rural technique of skilful improvisation with minimal tools and materials has been transferred to market towns.
